alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 1:46AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following counties, Elbert and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 345 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork Arikaree River, Lake Creek, Currie Creek, Sevenmile Creek, Hell Creek, Vega Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Dugout Creek, South Fork Republican River, Agate Creek, Middlemist Creek, Gordon Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Limon, Arriba, Genoa and Cedar Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
